item.title: Silent Hill: Townfall developer No Code rebrands to Screen Burn Interactive
item.content:encoded:
A new era for the Glasgow-based studio.

No Code, the studio behind Stories Untold, Observation, and the upcoming Silent Hill: Townfall, has rebranded under the new name Screen Burn Interactive, the studio announced.

“We’re not who we were in 2015,” said Screen Burn Interactive founder and creative director Jon McKellan, referring to the company’s two-person start in Glasgow, Scotland. “We’ve grown and changed. For a start, we have coders now! So, we needed a name that instead reflects what’s always been at the heart of the games themselves: the imperfect feel of old technology and the lasting impact of a story that stays with you long after the credits roll.”

Screen Burn Interactive aims to capture that spirit, comparing “the ghost of an image burned into an old CRT screen,” to the memory of a game forever imprinted on your mind.

Development on Silent Hill: Townfall remains underway with Konami and Annapurna Interactive. Further information will be announced at a later date.

item.title: The Player Who Can’t Level Up roguelite action game for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC launches in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

"Improvement comes from strategy, not stats."

The Player Who Can’t Level Up, the fast-paced roguelite action game based on the Korean webtoon, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam in 2026, developer Tripearl Games announced.

“We wanted to challenge how players think about progression,” said Tripearl Games CEO Manson Jeong in a press release. “In The Player Who Can’t Level Up, improvement comes from strategy, not stats—from learning and adapting, not grinding.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Tripearl Games:

About

Developed by Tripearl Games, this fast-paced action roguelite blends high-impact combat, bold visuals, and an all-new storyline created in collaboration with the original web novel and webtoon team.

The announcement trailer offers a thrilling look at the dynamic combat, boss encounters, and cinematic animations players can expect when the game launches.

At the center of the game is Kim Kigyu, a player destined to fight the world’s deadliest threats—but with a twist: he can’t level up. Instead, players will find themselves mastering unique combat styles, uncovering secrets hidden inside a mysterious gate, and evolving through every battle using roguelite mechanics.

A New Chapter in a Fan-Favorite Universe

The Player Who Can’t Level Up has already amassed over 210 million views and topped charts on Kakao Page, Piccoma, and Tapas. The game expands this beloved universe with a new side story, letting players explore unknown corners of the lore while fighting alongside familiar allies Lu and El.

Level Up? Nah—Evolve Strategically

Instead of conventional XP and grinding, The Player Who Can’t Level Up introduces Ego Shards (perk-style abilities) and Blessings (random enhancements) that let you build devastating synergies run after run. With roguelite progression, dynamic combat mechanics, and the visual firepower of Unreal Engine 5, players are in for a fast-paced, high-skill action experience — with zero loading screens and full camera control.

Key Features

  • Stylish, Responsive Combat – Fast-paced swordplay with regular, berserk, and awakening attacks.
  • Progress Through Play – Unlock new perks and enhancements on every run, creating different builds and strategies.
  • Powered by Unreal Engine 5 – Stunning full 3D visuals, free camera control, and fluid animations.
  • A Brand-New Narrative – Created in partnership with the original authors and artists for existing fans and newcomers alike.
  • Replayability at Its Core – Randomized skill combinations and progression paths encourage experimentation.

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment announces ChinaJoy 2025 lineup
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Phantom Blade Zero, Tang Legends: Silent Strings, andm ore.

Sony Interactive Entertainment Shanghai has announced its lineup for ChinaJoy 2025, which will run from August 1 to 4 at Shanghai New International Expo Centre.

The lineup of games playable at the Sony Interactive Entertainment booth are as follows:

  • Black Myth: Wukong (Game Science)
  • EXILEDGE (Enigmatrix)
  • Lost Soul Aside (Ultizero Games / Sony Interactive Entertainment)
  • Phantom Blade Zero (S-GAME)
  • Retrace the Light (Xiaming Game / GlintForge)
  • Tang Legends: Silent Strings (Virtuos)
  • Unending Dawn (Parcae’s Fate Studio)
  • Vanishing Starlight (Heart Seven / Gamepoch)
  • WUCHANG: Fallen Feathers (505 Games / Lenzee)
